snippet: The Supreme Court will hear a case in which a defendant is seeking a new trial by arguing that statements made by the jury’s forewoman showed that she should not have been selected as a juror.
abstract: Adam Liptak Sidebar column; Supreme Court is set to hear case that challenges the privacy of statements made during jury deliberations.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court will hear a case in which a defendant is seeking a new trial by arguing that statements made by the jury’s forewoman showed that she should not have been selected as a juror.

headline.print_headline: Challenging the Privacy of Statements Made During Jury Deliberations
headline.main: Challenging the Privacy of Statements Made During Jury Deliberations
